name: Visocco
description:
Rio Visocco is mostly a rappeling canyon, located near the main road Udine-Tarvisio, on the south side of the mountain Montusel. The canyon is steep and carved in white limstone, with many waterfalls. It has a small amount of water and is suitable for periods when other canyons in the area have too much water.

Zone: Friuli – Udine – Dogna (village)

Qualities: Entrance: 820 m Exit: 420 m Height: 400 m Length: 1000 m

Period April-October

Times: Approach: 0 min Progression: 2,5 h Return: 0 min

Shuttle: Yes (4 km)

Equipment: Expedition – 10 mm bolts and natural weapons

Rope: 2 x 40m

Biggest waterfall: 38 m

Possible exit Yes. In the middle of the canyon, on the left side (follow the path)

Maps: Tabacco Number 18

Attraction: Local

Difficulty: V3 a2 III

Approach

From Chiusaforte drive towards village Dogna. About 1 km before Dogna there is a couple of houses (Vidali), where you leave the first car near the little chapel. Afterwards drive under the highway, then turn left towards Porto, continue to the village Plagnis: From there drive 200 m, where the road crosses the creek (Rio Visocco). There is the entrance point.

Descent

The canyon begins as soon as you get out of the car, with some bouldery downclimbs. Stream has about 25 descents and some wild toboggans, which need to be checked. The first slide (it is in the middle of the canyon) has a trunk in the pool and we bypassed the waterfall on the right side. The last two slides are quite long and can be tobogganed after checking pool depth. After the last toboggan go left out of the canyon and after 50 meters you reach the car.

Exit

Red tape

Beta sites

  • Canyon.Carto.net  : Rio Visocco

Trip reports and media

Background

First descent on 23.4. 2012 by Canyoning Cult Slovenia. It was done only on on natural rigging. 23.10.2012 the same team repeated the descent and equipped the canyon with bolts.
